## Next
Use this domain inside Next.js projects.
### Next activation
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"domains": {
				"next": "on"
			}
		}
	}
}
```
### Next dependencies
Enabled when the following dependencies are declared:
- `next`: `>=14.0.0`

### Next rules
Rules that belong to the domain:
- [useExhaustiveDependencies](/linter/rules/use-exhaustive-dependencies)
- [useHookAtTopLevel](/linter/rules/use-hook-at-top-level)
- [noDocumentImportInPage](/linter/rules/no-document-import-in-page)
- [noHeadElement](/linter/rules/no-head-element)
- [noHeadImportInDocument](/linter/rules/no-head-import-in-document)
- [noImgElement](/linter/rules/no-img-element)
- [noUnwantedPolyfillio](/linter/rules/no-unwanted-polyfillio)
- [useGoogleFontDisplay](/linter/rules/use-google-font-display)
- [useGoogleFontPreconnect](/linter/rules/use-google-font-preconnect)
## React
Use this domain inside React projects. It enables a set of rules that can help catching bugs and enforce correct practices. This domain enable rules that might conflict with the Solid domain.
### React activation
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"domains": {
				"react": "on"
			}
		}
	}
}
```
### React dependencies
Enabled when the following dependencies are declared:
- `react`: `>=16.0.0`

### React rules
Rules that belong to the domain:
- [noRenderReturnValue](/linter/rules/no-render-return-value)
- [useExhaustiveDependencies](/linter/rules/use-exhaustive-dependencies)
- [useHookAtTopLevel](/linter/rules/use-hook-at-top-level)
- [useJsxKeyInIterable](/linter/rules/use-jsx-key-in-iterable)
## Solid
Use this domain inside Solid projects. This domain enables rules that might conflict with the React domain.
### Solid activation
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"domains": {
				"solid": "on"
			}
		}
	}
}
```
### Solid dependencies
Enabled when the following dependencies are declared:
- `solid`: `>=1.0.0`

### Solid rules
Rules that belong to the domain:
- [noDestructuredProps](/linter/rules/no-destructured-props)
- [useForComponent](/linter/rules/use-for-component)
- [noReactSpecificProps](/linter/rules/no-react-specific-props)
## Test
Use this domain when linting test files. It enables a set of rules that are library agnostic, and can help to catch possible misuse of the test APIs.
### Test activation
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"domains": {
				"test": "on"
			}
		}
	}
}
```
### Test dependencies
Enabled when the following dependencies are declared:
- `jest`: `>=26.0.0`
- `mocha`: `>=8.0.0`
- `ava`: `>=2.0.0`
- `vitest`: `>=1.0.0`

### Test globals
When enabled, the following global bindings are recognised by Biome:
- `after`
- `afterAll`
- `afterEach`
- `before`
- `beforeEach`
- `beforeAll`
- `describe`
- `it`
- `expect`
- `test`

### Test rules
Rules that belong to the domain:
- [noExcessiveNestedTestSuites](/linter/rules/no-excessive-nested-test-suites)
- [noDuplicateTestHooks](/linter/rules/no-duplicate-test-hooks)
- [noExportsInTest](/linter/rules/no-exports-in-test)
- [noFocusedTests](/linter/rules/no-focused-tests)
